attributes.action: Launch a Public Inquiry into Dominic Cummings’ role in the COVID-19 response
attributes.additional_details:
A troubling report available in The Sunday Times (22/03/20) suggests Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s Special Adviser Dominic Cummings revealed the Goverments strategy at the end of February as “herd immunity, protect the economy and if that means some pensioners die, too bad”. 

In a time of unprecedented public health crisis the Government response should be transparent and expert led, not guided by SpAds such as Cummings’ with little or no expertise in public health policy or epidemiology.
attributes.background: To launch a public inquiry into the initial and ongoing Government response to the Coronavirus pandemic and assess the role of Special Advisers in developing policy.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
